Thank you for a wonderful weekend stay at your place and highly recommend this to all looking to get away and enjoy trying things outside the norm and trying what your wildest dreams and desires want and need! Bradleyâ€™s tiny house is awesome! Itâ€™s very clean and very comfortable. We felt at home. You can tell a lot of time and effort was put into this tiny house. Itâ€™s creatively decorated and has an relaxing vibe. You feel like you are staying in a tiny beach house next to the ocean. My 6 year old son with sensory issues loved the moving blue lights on the porch. Out of our two week vacation he was the most relaxed staying in the tiny house, it made for a relaxing time for me. I only wish I had booked it for longer. My 8 year old who is gifted was fascinated with the construction and design of the tiny home. My son enjoyed looking at all of the treasures that tell a story. It was a great place to unplug.
I appreciated the camera and heavy duty locks on the door as I was traveling alone with my two sons. I felt very safe. Bradley greeted us shortly after we arrived. He was very prompt in response to any questions I had. He was very professional and down to earth. We enjoyed our time so much that my boys want to come back again next year. Our stay in Bradleyâ€™s home far exceeded my expectations!
Thank you!

Highly recommended for anyone looking to stay here!
The hosts were kind, great to talk to and friendly, but also aren't TOO talkative (we had time to ourselves). The place had just about every amenity that you could ever want and the hosts were extremely thoughtful with the room layout. The room couldn't have been cleaner, it was immaculate. The room was extremely comfortable, the bed was amazing, and the fan did an excellent job. There was plenty of lighting and it led to a very homey vibe.
On top of that, the wifi was excellent and plenty fast for any kind of work (I rely on wifi for work and it was great for me). There was also a desk which was actually useful and usable.
Overall, we had an amazing stay and we highly recommend you also stay here! We have been to many, many Airbnbs and this one is top-notch!

,
Â·
Stayed about a week
review_text: Vicky and Marvin were probably the most hospitable hosts I have ever encountered. They really do want you to make yourself at home. I really appreciated being able to freely use what I needed, especially the washer and dryer. They both have such good spirits and the room is warm (in feel, not temperature) and comfortable. Everything was as pictured, clean and the decor inspired a sense of positivity. It is quiet and peaceful and they really made sure not to make noise when they thought I might be asleep. I also appreciate how understanding and flexible they are. I had some changes to my itinerary and they were very accommodating. Vicky asked how the temperature was to make sure that I was comfortable and said I could adjust it. That was thoughtful. They are very friendly and I enjoyed speaking with both of them. They also gave me my space and I knew when I was in the room that I would have my privacy and not be disturbed. I felt very comfortable keeping to myself to take care of what I needed and also welcome to interact. Everything is spelled out in the check-in instructions and Vicky is very communicative. Parking is convenient. I look forward to my return.

review_text:
my husband and i had the pleasure of staying at casa de mi padre while i recovered from a specialized medical procedure. while our visit to jax wasn't a fun one, this airbnb's comfort (tricked out recliners!) and homey touches (makeup wipes by the bed!) provided some much needed ease and lightness. jc was the perfect host and proactively reached out to help us strategize post-surgery sleeping spots since it's a split level, which was really touching.
the only nit i can pick is that, since it's a newer building, noises from the neighborhood and nearby expressway were a touch loud. (and we're from chicago!) but we also came during what turned out to be bike week at daytona, so it's def not the airbnb's fault lol.
i can imagine this spot is perfect for families, or for anyone looking for a truly hospitable experience. i'll be thinking fondly of casa de mi padre!

Stayed with a pet
review_text: My stay with Jason was perfect. The location is in a great neighborhood, close to everything one may need (food, groceries, shops, restaurants) and centrally located, making Jacksonville exploration easy and convenient. The quarters were immaculate, well-designed and as beautiful as the photos. The place is stocked with all you need for daily life, including a vacuum and mini iron (I was very impressed by these two items). The bed and bedding was super comfy; upstairs was like being in a luxurious treehouse, with vaulted ceilings and windows looking out onto lush greenery. I especially appreciated the off-street parking between the guest house and main house - it couldn't be more secure. Jason was readily available, super helpful and wonderfully accommodating. I would highly recommend his place and would definitely stay here again.

review_text: We enjoyed staying at this extended stay Airbnb for 2 weeks. It had a kitchenette we did use but it was also easy to get food deliveries. We were within walking distance of a couple restaurants including Bagel Love, and had a dedicated parking spot. Our host was very responsive to our needs. At one point there was a thunderstorm and the power went out briefly and then the internet was down. He had it fixed very quickly. We were also glad to have on site laundry accessible at the main house via the back door. Of note, the spiral staircase was hard for our small dog to navigate so we did carry him up and down. It was close to NAS Jacksonville where I was working and an easy commute. We would recommend for a couple or individual for extended stay.

The bedroom had some of the softest sheets me and my husband have ever slept in and the bathroomâ€¦ well you gotta see it for yourself! immaculate, very well thought outâ€¦ i actually thought there wasnâ€™t a toilet at first because it is a little private area in the corner of the bathroom! forgot your soaps or bubble bath foamsâ€¦ no worries Marianna even left us items for the bubble bath! Group trip
review_text: First I want to say this house is immaculate. The pictures does not do it justice. We used the Airbnb to celebrate my son's 18th birthday. This location was perfect for the event. Chanda was very helpful from the very first inquiry to the end. Checkin went very smooth. The house was clean and everything was in place. Their ice machine wasn't working but she had ice waiting when we got there. Also, she got us a few bottles of wine (Which I enjoyed because they are my favorite lol). At the last minute I asked for late checkout and she allowed us to stay a little longer. That was very helpful since the night before we didn't do much cleaning after the party. This home also has an outdoor space which is screened in. So we didn't have to worry about any bugs in this Florida heat. All in all I would definitely go through her again. If you are coming to Florida I definitely recommend her. It's worth the money!!

review_text: Starting with the positive; the place is cozily and thoughtfully decorated. I think itâ€™s a great deal for the price point & itâ€™s a good place to rest your head at night. Biggest pet peeve was that every night I had to park around the corner, carrying groceries, etc because parking spots were always occupied across the street. Also, I questioned the host if he would allow my family members to be my guest or even come inside, to which his response is that he normally â€œdoesnâ€™t allow more than 2 inside the apartment,â€ and notes that it is very small. Upon reading the house rules, guests are not allowed, not even for one hour otherwise the reservation will be cancelled and not refunded, being monitored by external camerasâ€¦so, they take that pretty seriously around here! Wi-Fi is pretty unstable as it keeps alternating between the various networks nearby and has trouble connecting. Another thing worth nothing is that check out time is before 10AM. Bathroom could use some remodeling.

review_text: The cleaning chemical smell on arrival was so strong it gave me a headache that lingered into the next day. Had to kill a roach in between the shower curtains. The louvered door into the closet area to the back door had heavy thick, dust in between each crack. The ceiling tiles in front of bathroom and bedroom are falling down to the point you can see the duct work, & very dusty. The doors and windows have a LOT of layers of paint on them, & the noise outside is very well heard since they do not seal. This is an apartment that is accessed by a hallway, which is accessed by all tenants in the building that is three stories. This particular one is on the ground floor. I would not recommend this place to anyone since I expect for every place I stay out of town to at least be the same quality of the house I live in. This was not a safe place for anyone in my opinion! Just not a good experience for me. Hosts were attentive and available, but I didnâ€™t need them for anything.

Rating, 3 stars

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I think it's necessary to leave honest reviews so I'm gonna be detailed here. The hosts were lovely and very helpful and responsive. The location was decent and the bedroom (we appreciated the black-out curtains!) and living room are reflected well in the listing's photos.
However, in the case of this listing, "historic" just means old (ie a lot of stuff crudely patched or painted over a million times). The lighting was super dim everywhere and, though the mattress was pretty comfortable, the bed frame didn't feel very sturdy. I also think the frequencies from other apts' remotes messed with the lights (same fixtures) because the light in the living room kept turning off. There was also a weird smell coming from the fridge and a generally moldy smell in the kitchen/dining room combo... which probably has something to do with the cockroaches we saw. We saw three during our three-day stay, one of which was the biggest cockroach we've ever seen. We ended up sleeping with the dining/living room lights on to keep the roaches in hiding (we only saw them in or around the kitchen).
Overall, it's an ok place to stay if you're gonna be there to just bathe and sleep like we were. Idk, maybe we visited on a bad weekend.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Jorge is a fantastic host; heâ€™s great with communication and answered all my questions within 10mins. The Airbnb is beautiful; it looks EXACTLY like the pictures. I was on a business trip so I needed internet access and the wifi was terrible from the bedroom some moments it worked, then some moments I couldn't open google. For the best wifi connection, I had to be in the living room for service. The only thing is, itâ€™s in a sketchy neighborhood. I had an Uber driver cancel the trip because they didnâ€™t want to pick me up due to location.
Upon booking, I told Jorge that Iâ€™d be checking into his Airbnb at 7 pm due to me having a late flight and asked if I could check out at 4 pm on my last day due to my flight being late. He told me no. He stated that check-out is at 10 AM, and Iâ€™d have to pay for another night if I wanted to check out that late.

name: Julie
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
Â·
May 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I would definitely tame expectations for this place. The photos are beautiful and it is definitely well-decorated for the modern/boho vibe, however, this is a really old historic building and it shows.
The neighborhood is rough - there are some nice homes sprinkled in and you can tell it's a gentrified neighborhood. I wouldn't feel safe walking by myself because up a block was this gas station that had questionable activities and people there. Despite that, it is a quiet neighborhood and the building itself is quiet at night.
Upon entry, we noticed that it heavily smelled like bug spray but thankfully no bugs our entire stay. The place is really homey and chic, which was appreciated. The AC was also at a very comfortable temperature and was lovely throughout our stay.
The bathroom could use some work. The tub in the shower had a big dip in the center of it and felt as if you were sinking. There was black mold along the caulking of the tub and didn't seem very clean. The ceiling in the hallway between the bathroom and bedroom had some sort of water damage or something...looked like it was falling apart.
The bedroom was spacious and the bed was ok. The wifi is extremely spotty and I would get bumped on and off using it in bed. Really appreciated the ceiling fan though as I love sleeping with a fan at night.
Overall, wasn't a horrible stay but it also wasn't the best. Jorge and his team were extremely responsive and I appreciated the detailed communication and information that was given. They rectified a minor issue upon check-in very quickly so thank you for that! I think with a little more work, the place could be really nice.

February 2022
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text:
It's a perfectly fine spot. Jorge had good coffee, nice breakfast snacks, and plenty of cookware in the kitchen. The house is comfy and nicely decorated and has a good layout. The neighborhood is pleasant, though just a few blocks away from less developed areas. All of the houses around the block are very nice looking, old historic houses with good lighting at night.
Parking was easy, we were always able to park near the apartment. In winter months, the heat doesn't get back to the bedroom very efficiently but it wasn't too bad. There's a space heater in the closet in case you need it, but only one blanket provided. Overall it's a nice space for a reasonable price and we enjoyed our stay.
